data.title: PhaseTracer: Cosmological phases mapping
data.name: PhaseTracer
data.description: PhaseTracer is a C++ software package for mapping out cosmological phases, and potential transitions between them, for Standard Model extensions with any number of scalar fields.

evidence: "PhaseTracer is a C++14 software package for tracing cosmological phases, finding potential phase transitions, computing the bounce action, and plotting the gravitational wave spectrum for Standard Model extensions with any number of scalar fields."

Build and run instructions are via cloning and compiling the repository: "git clone https://github.com/PhaseTracer/PhaseTracer" followed by cmake and make, then running example binaries like "./bin/run_1D_test_model".

The README includes citations to physics research articles describing the code (e.g., "PhaseTracer: tracing cosmological phases and calculating transition properties"), indicating it is a domain-specific research tool used to produce scientific results.
